instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3330B: What is 820-3330B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb not working.
threads.message:
I'm working on this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had a previous usb port not working. now the other port has stopped working. At first it would work intermittently and now not at all. the usb A port is working perfectly.

i am getting 5v on pin one of j4700, I couldn't find a short to ground but when measuring pins 2 and 3 i had .0L on them which is different from the other port. i do have continuity from the pins to 3-4 of <DIODE>D4700</DIODE>, also I'm getting 3.4v on pin 3-4 and 0.198v on pins 2-5 of <DIODE>D4700</DIODE>.

any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb not working.
threads.message: usually bad L4600/L4700. Check diode mode measurement to ground, red probe on ground, on pins 6 & 7 of <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> and pins 4/5/6/7 of <CHIP>U2760</CHIP>

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> usb not working.
threads.message:
thanks for the reply. upon checking for the diode measurements (all were good) i decided to check continuity on L4700 and noticed i had a connection to the top of the inductor but not the bottom. looked like there was a break in the trace that went from bottom of the inductor to the top. kinda strange. repealed and replaced all is working great again. 

Thanks again louis. SOLVED
